intro: Astragalus bracteosus, commonly known as the bracteate milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to drought conditions. It produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus bracteosus plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native habitat.
